item.title: ChiEngMixBench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Spontaneous and Natural Chinese-English Code-Mixed Generation
item.description: arXiv:2601.16217v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Code-mixing is increasingly prevalent in interactions between humans and large language models, yet existing work often reduces it to a translation or convertibility problem, making it difficult to assess whether a model's switching behavior is contex...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, context, alignment, arxiv, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Domain Specific Specialization in Low-Resource Settings: The Efficacy of Offline Response-Based Knowledge Distillation in Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.16219v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) excel in general tasks but often struggle with hallucinations when handling domain-specific or institutional knowledge absent from their pre-training. We present an offline response-based knowledge distillation method that...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, context, library, experiment, memory | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Generating Literature-Driven Scientific Theories at Scale
item.description: arXiv:2601.16282v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Contemporary automated scientific discovery has focused on agents for generating scientific experiments, while systems that perform higher-level scientific activities such as theory building remain underexplored.
